intro: Gaudichaudia hilairiana, commonly known as the island lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are slender and herbaceous. Gaudichaudia hilairiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
